Qualifiers.scope: Daylight-plane envelope for accessory structures at side lot lines.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to accessory buildings/structures located at or near side lot lines. The structure must fit under the prescribed daylight plane originating at the side lot line(s).

source.figure_caption: Front elevation showing accessory-structure daylight plane at the side of the lot

ambiguous_language_flags: The phrase 'near the rear & side lot lines' does not define a distance threshold; treat as applying at property-line condition unless otherwise defined elsewhere.
The daylight-plane slope label shows '3' over '1' without axis definition; vertical:horizontal vs horizontal:vertical is ambiguous.
The datum 'average grade' is referenced but not defined; method of determining average grade is unspecified.
The '12' max height of building' is shown in the figures; whether this is a sitewide absolute cap for accessory structures or only illustrative is not explicit.

average_grade_elevation_at_side_lot_line.description: Project-specific elevation reference used to establish the 8 ft start height of the daylight plane at the side lot line.

building_height_profile.description: Height of the accessory structure at all points along sections perpendicular to each side lot line, measured from average grade. Used to test against daylight plane and 12 ft cap.

structure_offset_from_side_lot_line.description: Horizontal distance from side lot line to the nearest point of the accessory structure at each section. Used to compute allowable daylight-plane height at that point.
structure_offset_from_side_lot_line.note: The regulation appears to apply regardless of setback; if setback is zero, the plane starts at the lot line.

roof_form.description: Roof configuration; may assist in compliance. Not mandated.

daylight_plane_start_height.reference: above average grade at the side lot line

daylight_plane_slope_ratio.source_label: diagram shows '3' over '1' next to the daylight-plane line

max_building_height.reference: labeled '12' max height of building' in figure
max_building_height.assumed_applicability: global cap for accessory structure height pending confirmation

mandatory: Establish a daylight plane at each side lot line that begins at 8 ft above average grade at the lot line and slopes inward toward the lot interior at the labeled 3:1 ratio.
The accessory structure must be entirely below (i.e., not pierce) the daylight plane originating from each adjacent side lot line.
The accessory structure height must not exceed 12 ft anywhere.
optional: A hipped-gable roof is suggested as often the best solution to comply with the daylight plane.
conditional_logic: If the structure is adjacent to two side lot lines, compute and enforce both daylight planes; the governing envelope is the intersection of the two planes.

If the interpretation of the 3:1 slope is clarified as V:H, the allowable height increases 3 ft for every 1 ft of horizontal distance from the lot line above the 8 ft start. If clarified as H:V, the allowable height increases 1 ft for every 3 ft of horizontal distance from the lot line above the 8 ft start.
If average grade is defined elsewhere, use that method; otherwise flag for manual verification before automated compliance.
validation_steps: For each section perpendicular to each side lot line, measure horizontal offset x (ft) from the lot line to the building surface.
Compute daylight-plane allowable height h_plane(x) = 8 ft + slope(x) per the 3:1 ratio once axis definition is resolved.
Compute actual building height h_bldg(x) from average grade.
Check h_bldg(x) <= h_plane(x) for all x along the building adjacent to that side.
Check h_bldg(x) <= 12 ft for all x.
If both side lot lines apply, repeat for both sides and enforce both constraints simultaneously.

hierarchical: The daylight-plane control and the absolute 12 ft height cap both apply; the stricter of the two governs at any location.
cross_references: Figure 25: front elevation context shows planes from left and right side lot lines.
logical_dependencies: Daylight-plane start height depends on average grade at the side lot line.
Daylight-plane allowable height at any point depends on horizontal distance from the side lot line and the slope ratio.

mandatory: Establish a daylight plane at the rear lot line that begins at 8 ft above average grade at the lot line and slopes inward toward the lot interior at the labeled 3:1 ratio.
The accessory structure must be entirely below (i.e., not pierce) the daylight plane originating from the rear lot line.
The accessory structure height must not exceed 12 ft anywhere.
optional: A hipped-gable roof is suggested as often the best solution to comply with the daylight plane.
conditional_logic: If the interpretation of the 3:1 slope is clarified as V:H, the allowable height increases 3 ft for every 1 ft of horizontal distance from the rear lot line above the 8 ft start. If clarified as H:V, the allowable height increases 1 ft for every 3 ft of horizontal distance from the rear lot line above the 8 ft start.
If average grade is defined elsewhere, use that method; otherwise flag for manual verification before automated compliance.
validation_steps: For each section perpendicular to the rear lot line, measure horizontal offset x (ft) from the lot line to the building surface.
Compute daylight-plane allowable height h_plane(x) = 8 ft + slope(x) per the 3:1 ratio once axis definition is resolved.
Compute actual building height h_bldg(x) from average grade.
Check h_bldg(x) <= h_plane(x) for all x along the building adjacent to the rear lot line.
Check h_bldg(x) <= 12 ft for all x.

hierarchical: The daylight-plane control and the absolute 12 ft height cap both apply; the stricter of the two governs at any location.
cross_references: Figure 26: side elevation context shows plane sloping inward from the rear lot line.
logical_dependencies: Daylight-plane start height depends on average grade at the rear lot line.
Daylight-plane allowable height at any point depends on horizontal distance from the rear lot line and the slope ratio.
